channel.title: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)

item.title: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)
item.dc:creator: @TheDarkMage TheDarkMage
item.description:
@TheDarkMage wrote:

your random wait times need to be more random (need an example? wait(randomrange(497,572)) instead of wait(500+random(32)) or something like that but anyways i don’t think jagex records your mouse and keyboard actions before you log in do they?

Read full topic
item.source: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)

item.title: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)
item.dc:creator: @omg_omg_omg omg omg omg
item.description:
@omg_omg_omg wrote:

You’ve improved his script quite a bit, but using SRL includes would make it A LOT better. instead of using movemouse and clickmouse, you can use mmouse(x, y, randomx, randomy,) and
mouse(x, y, randomx, randomy, true). Also, you should have your script add a random amount to your waittime. An example of this would be if you wanted it to wait 3 seconds plus an extra amount of seconds up to 2, you would put wait(3000 + random(2000)).

Read full topic
item.source: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)

item.title: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

Woah, hold up there.
The bitmaps are way to big in size. Cut down the size to at least 40x40 as SCAR will be able to find the bitmaps quicker. And yes, add a [b]freeBitmap/b; as it will not lag the computers guts out. Also remove your username and password.

Here is a simple Login Script that you should learn from:[code]program LoginScript; //Name of the entire script, not really
//needed.
const
Username = ‘Username Here’; //Enter your username between the ’ ’
Password = ‘Password Here’; //Enter your password betwenn the ’ ’

var
Login, ExUser, x, y: Integer; //Start Declaring the Variables.

procedure Bitmaps; //Loading Bitmaps.
begin //Bitmaps are not set.
end;

procedure StartLoginProcess; //Will start the following:
begin
if(FindBitmap(ExUser,x,y)) then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y) //Moves the mouse to the Existing user
Wait(1000) //Waits 1 second
ClickMouse(x,y,True); //Left Clicks on the picture
SendKeys(Username + Chr(13)); //Type in the Username provided
Wait(100) //Waits 100 milliseconds
SendKeys(Password + Chr(13)); //Types in the Password provided
Wait(1000) //Waits 1 second
if(FindBitmap(Login,x,y)) then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y); //Moves the mouse to the login picture
Wait(769) //Waits 769 milliseconds
ClickMouse(x,y,True); //Left clicks the mose
if(FindColor(x,y,0,0,0,0,0)) then
MoveMouseSmooth(x,y); //Moves the mouse to the colour
Wait(1000) //Waits 1 second
ClickMouse(x,y,True); //Left clicks where the colour is
Sleep(100) //Will make the click more human
end; //Ends the above.

procedure FreeBitmapsNow; //Will start the following:
begin
FreeBitmap(Login); //Free the bitmap Login so it
//doesn’t waste much memory (lag)
FreeBitmap(ExUser); //Free the bitmap ExUser so it
//doesn’t waste much memory (lag)
end; //Ends the above.

begin //Main lines. Scar looks for these
Bitmaps; //Will load the procedure: Bitmaps
StartLoginProcess; //Will load the 2nd procedure.
FreeBitmapsNow; //Will load the 3rd procedure.
end.[/code]
No bitmaps have been added and no coordinates.

Read full topic
item.source: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)

item.title: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)
item.dc:creator: @omg_omg_omg omg omg omg
item.description:
@omg_omg_omg wrote:

I highly recommend using the freebitmap function for this script. Just put freebitmap bitmapname;
after every bitmap.[br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2007, 02:44:47 AM[/size][hr]Oh, and if there are any mistakes, I’m just too tired to notice them… having your parents take the mouse to their room when they go to bed doesn’t help either. -.-

Read full topic
item.source: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)

item.title: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)
item.dc:creator: @danmazmanzcool danmazmanzcool
item.description:
@danmazmanzcool wrote:

Now I have been learning for 10 mins and I have come up with this (uses bitmaps instead of movemouse)
Gonna have to slice it across 2 posts(Hope u don’t mind)
Dam its too big.

[code]program Bitmapload;
var
x,y,Bitmap,Logbmp,ClickHereToplay:integer;

end;[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: July 02, 2006, 07:26:32 am[/size][hr]Procedure play;
begin
wait(300+random(32))
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(32+random(16))
clickmouse(x,y,true)
end;

Procedure Findplay;
begin
if(FindBitmap(ClickHereToplay,x,y))then
play;
end;

Procedure Clicklog;
begin
wait(300+random(32))
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(32+random(16))
clickmouse(x,y,true)
end;

procedure Findlog;
begin
if(FindBitmap(logbmp,x,y))then
Clicklog;
end;

procedure ClickBMPint;
begin
wait(300+random(32))
movemousesmooth(x,y)
wait(32+random(16))
clickmouse(x,y,true)
end;

Procedure FindBMPint;
begin
if(FindBitmap(Bitmap,x,y))then
ClickBMPint;
end;

begin
wait(1300)
BMP;
FindBMPint;
wait(1000);
SendKeys(‘danmanzcool1’); //type user in here
wait(1000);
KeyDown(13);
wait(1000);
keyUp(13);
wait(1000);
SendKeys(‘speedyman’); //type password here
Wait(1000);
login;
Findlog;
wait(4000); //edit this if its too fast/slow
Lastscreen;
Findplay;

wait(1000);
end.

Read full topic
item.source: (RS2) My first script (yes another login script)
